theme: Creation, Fall, Promise - God's plan to restore through Abraham's seed
messiahProfile: Seed who crushes serpent; blessing to all nations through Abraham's line
overview: Genesis shows God's good creation, humanity's fall into sin, and God's promise to restore all things through one family line.

expository.context: Perfect garden, one command, enter the serpent
expository.tension: Did God really say? Can we trust Him?
expository.structure: v.1-7 (Temptation and fall), v.8-13 (Hiding and blame), v.14-24 (Judgment and promise)
expository.messiahProfile: Seed of woman who will crush serpent's head
expository.messiahLink: Genesis 3:15 - first gospel promise: a descendant will defeat the serpent
expository.notes: Pattern: Doubt God's word → Act independently → Hide in shame → God pursues and promises rescue

narrative.storyPanels: Panel 1: Serpent questions God's word. Panel 2: Eve takes, Adam follows. Panel 3: Eyes opened to shame. Panel 4: God curses but promises seed
narrative.pattern: Sin pattern: Doubt → Desire → Disobedience → Death (but God promises life through seed)
narrative.messiahLink: The seed promised in 3:15 is Jesus - He crushes Satan's head at the cross
narrative.notes: First sin, first shame, first sacrifice (animal skins), first promise of Messiah

expository.context: After Babel's judgment, God starts over with one man
expository.tension: How will God bless the nations? Through what family?
expository.structure: v.1-3 (Promise: Land, offspring, blessing), v.4-9 (Abraham's obedient journey)
expository.messiahProfile: The seed through whom all nations will be blessed
expository.messiahLink: Paul says this promise to Abraham was the gospel beforehand (Gal 3:8) - fulfilled in Jesus
expository.notes: Three-fold promise: Land, Seed, Blessing. All fulfilled ultimately in Jesus

narrative.storyPanels: Panel 1: God tests Abraham. Panel 2: Journey to Moriah. Panel 3: Isaac bound on altar. Panel 4: God provides ram
narrative.pattern: God tests to reveal faith; He provides the lamb
narrative.messiahLink: Father willing to sacrifice beloved son → God provides substitute → Points to Jesus, God's provided Lamb
narrative.notes: Isaac carries wood like Jesus carried cross. Ram caught in thorns like Jesus wore thorns. God will provide
